title: How to overcome long-term impostor syndrome - Quora

response.answer_text: Probably you don’t. Just put it in its place. It’s healthy for you to question your qualifications, to recognize your good fortune, to tally up your lucky breaks. It keeps you grateful, it keeps you humble, and it helps you to plan for a fall. Just don’t let it dominate you. It’s like an old friend who’s kind of hard to take but who sometimes gives you good leads. Meet him for a drink, but don’t let him move into your house.

Do things that you don’t think you can do… and then push further. Once you’re actually at your max level (you can do the work, but it costs you a lot of time and energy), you dial back. Now you know you’re in you’re comfort zone again. Actually you just really need the experience thatching can do more than you’re doing now ;)
